content: The camera is incredible, especially handheld at night. The wide lens is super useful and I am glad I upgraded.
The result of using the camera on the iPhone 11 Pro is astonishing! I was blown away by the quality of the pictures.
The iPhone 11 is almost 5 years old, but it still holds up pretty darn well. It's still a great phone in 2024.
The iPhone 11 might be older, but it could be one of the best budget iPhones available right now, I still recommend it.
If you're happy with the shape and screen size, the iPhone 11 is a relative bargain and is a very good option in today's market.
The Apple iPhone 11 is so good you probably don't even need the Pro version of the phone. The regular version has all you need.
I have a charger that came with my iPhone 11 Pro and I use it all the time. It charges pretty fast and does the job.
I just wrote a review on an iPhone 11 Pro case that I recently purchased. So far, it seems like a solid case.
Do not buy this phone, if you seriously want an iPhone get the iPhone 15 instead, a far better phone at around the same price.
I am surprised that the iPhone 11 is very conservative in both technology and design, with a thick bezel and rectangular shape.
The iPhone 11 is a great phone that can handle all your daily needs. It boasts an excellent camera and a good user interface.
The iPhone 11 is worth it, being much more powerful than Android phones. It is also the most secure mobile device currently available.
The iPhone 11 doesn't look new and the base model is cheaper, but it lost the good OLED screen and now has a cheap LED. It is disappointing.
The camera quality is very low with only 12MP. The main issue is with the iPhone's battery life, which drains quickly.
It's great because I mostly play games like PUBG Mobile on my iPhone 6 with only 1GB of RAM and the gameplay is so smooth.
In 2025, the iPhone 11 remains a solid budget option. It has smooth performance, reliable cameras, and still receives iOS updates.
The iPhone 11 is not 120Hz and doesn't have 5G. If you're okay with a regular 60Hz display and 4G, it could be a good choice.
It has the same array of cameras that the iPhone 11 Pro Max has. I predict that the Max will suffer at the end.
The iPhone 11 currently has the best camera in a smartphone. Reviews generally agree on this point, which makes it a great choice.
The iPhone 11 pro is still a good phone to have in 2025. It's still getting iOS updates and supports daily use apps.
The iPhone 11 has Face ID, a bigger and brighter screen, is much faster, has a bigger battery, is more durable, and comes with other features.
As we all know, you get 2 cameras with the iPhone 11. It is a decent experience overall if you want a simple and reliable system.
The battery percentage is reducing quickly. It drops one percent every few minutes, which is not normal and needs attention.
The iPhone 11 is much faster than any and all Android phones. The full fledged reviews are saying that the iPhone 11 Max is the best.
The battery life on my iPhone 11 has started draining a lot faster and charging a lot slower than usual, which is concerning.
iPhone 11 is very much a value buy in 2022 because it is a great device with everything that you want from an iPhone, but at a lower cost.
The iPhone 11 is super sleek and probably the sexiest phone I’ve ever held!
I missed my Fold so bad I switched back after a week of using the 17 Pro Max.
Paint chipping and face unlock not as useful as Face ID are my only issues with it.
I recently was interested in the iPhone 17, but I snapped out of it and got a Z Fold 7.
I traded my iPhone 15 Pro Max for the Fold because iPhone became boring after 15 years.
I switched to the Samsung Z Fold 7 and it's good so far, still configuring some things.
I switched from a 16 Pro, but only lasted 3 days before switching back to Apple.
I left iPhones for the Fold 5 and never looked back, the 7 is the best phone ever.
I'm over 2 months in and this is amazing, though my Pixel had a better camera.
I just went from my IPhone 16 Pro to the Galaxy Z Fold 7 and I’m in love.
The Z Fold 6 is the best device I ever had. I had iPhones like 8 Plus, 11, 14 Pro Max.
I used it for a month and went back to Apple, the ecosystem sucks big time.
The lack of UDC always puts me off, but it's an amazing device otherwise for me.
I was not seeing the smooth iOS I had been told of for many years, it hurts the experience.
I have the new Pixel, they say this thing never slows down and it's true for me.
iPhone seems to have much sharper images with night mode than Pixel for me.
Hearing him praise the 11 Pro is either a big change or the iPhone is crushing it.
Every iPhone user should give thanks to Google and the Pixel because competition is good.
The 11 Pro should have had the promotion display this year, it is not a big jump.
I normally don't like phone reviews, but this one was ridiculously good in my opinion.
I just use my old iPhone charger, you aren’t required to use the USB C cable from the box.
The green color looks so much better in this video than in any of Apple's images.
Can someone explain Apple’s goal here, why does Apple lags behind other phones?
I mean I get it, it's a great phone, but people spend 1500 for a smartphone?
I want to go iPhone again because iPhones are quality hardware and software ruined.
I'm tired of Android because of the tiny hiccups I run across daily, so I switch.
This is good writing, for someone buying these phones, this is a great write up.
This is very thorough, I'm amazed anyone uses as many features as OP does.
Android plus windows is much easier than iphone plus windows for me definitely.
This is probably the most accurate description of Android vs iOS for me right now.
I went from an iPhone to Android and can agree with some of your points here.
iPhones have had better touch input from the very first generation definitely.
Very good write up, file management is better than iOS but the OS keeps me away.
The review overall feels inclined towards one side, without an objective view.
What I really miss on Android is file-sharing capability like AirDrop on Macbook.
